description: standing male figure, seen from back, PL side, with PL foot up on a short platform; man bends slightly at the waist and leans slightly forward, with PL arm upraised
inscription:
Inscription

on back, in pencil: [Fancelli] and [113-4=55  P]
medium: Pen, brown ink, gray wash and black chalk on laid paper
provenance: La Société historique et littéraire polonaise, Paris (until 1972; sale, Christie's, London, July 4, 1972, part of no. 55, for 90 gns., to Mathews); [Alister Mathews, Bournemouth, England, 1972-74; sold September 8, for £30, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1974-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Standing Male Figure, Study for Saint John the Baptist Preaching
